column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had a severe case of bacterial menengitis, I was lucky and the only thing I have after my illness is severe migrains and seizures. column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've had migraine and tension headaches since 1984.  I've taken all types of medications with little or no results in preventing my headaches.  Until recently, I was taking Midrin, but since it's been discontinued my doctor prescribed 'PRODRIN'.   I take it twice a day to prevent the onset of headaches.  And I haven't had a headache since.  I was taking Midrin twice a day and then if I got a headache I would take Axert.  I have yet to take the Axert to date.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

I can fully function with Prodrin. Was paying an average of $41.00 with insurance but as of today, the price has doubled to $80.00. I do not understand why but will have to pay to feel human.

column2: 19-24 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column9: best thing since sliced bread.  makes me a little drowsy, but minor detail.  Gets rid of headache almost immediately.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I went to  urgent care after having a headache for 3 straight days.  I have been experiencing migraines for the last few months  and nothing was working. The PA prescribed me prodrin and advised me to take  2 pills at first and then one every hour until headache is gone.  I had to go to three pharmacies to find this medication because no one seemed to have it in stock. Once I got home I took 2 pills right away and ate a meal.  30 minutes later my headache was gone which I was extremely relieved.  However I did notice my heart racing quite a bit and figured it was the caffeine in the pill.  Since then I have been taking just one pill with the onset of a headache and this has been taking my headaches away and I do not notice my heart racing at all.

column2: guest commentary, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Dr gave for migraine and tension headaches.  Had migraines since I was 8 yrs old (for 40 yrs now).  Prodrin works very well.  I have not had any of the side effects that others are describing.  Very pleased.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My doctor recommended this drug when midrin was discontinued and said it was the same thing. I took midrin before and was somewhat pleased with the results. With Prodrin, I took as the label said and felt very drowsey, loopy, felt faint when I stood up, had crawly skin, rapid heartrate, it kept me from sleeping, and made me see spots. It did help with my headache temporarily, but after the drug wore off, my headache was back. For me it gives some relief, but I can only take it when I don't have to work, sleep, or drive.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I can't tell you how relieved I was after the first two doses of Prodrin after suffering three days with a migraine headache. column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have also suffered from very bad migraines for years. Since trying this  med my migraines are well controlled. column2: rfammy, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have suffered for migraines for 3 or 4 years now.  I have tried many of the triptans, excedred migraine and some butabital, but I couldn't find the right combination.  triptans made me sick and the others just didn't work.  I was givin prodrin samples about a month ago, and it knocked out my migraine.  So far so good.  I did some research and I found that Prodrin has double the amount of isometheptene than a product called midrin.  So to help with the jittery feeling I only took 1 prodrin every hour until my migraine ended.  Help with the jitters.  It might help with some of the other minor side effets.
